Catalano.Imaging.Tools

Class ColorConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • Catalano.Imaging.Tools.ColorConverter

  • public class ColorConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    Convert between different color spaces supported. RGB -> YIQ -> RGB RGB -> YCbCr -> RGB RGB -> YUV -> RGB RGB -> RGChromaticity RGB -> HSV -> RGB RGB -> YCC -> RGB RGB -> YCoCg -> RGB RGB -> XYZ -> RGB RGB -> HunterLAB -> RGB XYZ -> HunterLAB -> XYZ

    • Method Detail

      • RGBtoYUV

        public static float[] RGBtoYUV(int red,
               int green,
               int blue)
        RGB -> YUV. Y in the range [0..1]. U in the range [-0.5..0.5]. V in the range [-0.5..0.5].
        Parameters:
        red - Values in the range [0..255].
        green - Values in the range [0..255].
        blue - Values in the range [0..255].
        Returns:
        YUV color space.

      • YUVtoRGB

        public static int[] YUVtoRGB(float y,
             float u,
             float v)
        YUV -> RGB.
        Parameters:
        y - Luma. In the range [0..1].
        u - Chrominance. In the range [-0.5..0.5].
        v - Chrominance. In the range [-0.5..0.5].
        Returns:
        RGB color space.

      • RGBtoYIQ

        public static float[] RGBtoYIQ(int red,
               int green,
               int blue)
        RGB -> YIQ.
        Parameters:
        red - Values in the range [0..255].
        green - Values in the range [0..255].
        blue - Values in the range [0..255].
        Returns:
        YIQ color space.

      • YIQtoRGB

        public static int[] YIQtoRGB(double y,
             double i,
             double q)
        YIQ -> RGB.
        Parameters:
        y - Luma. Values in the range [0..1].
        i - In-phase. Values in the range [-0.5..0.5].
        q - Quadrature. Values in the range [-0.5..0.5].
        Returns:
        RGB color space.

      • RGChromaticity

        public static double[] RGChromaticity(int red,
                      int green,
                      int blue)
        Rg-Chromaticity space is already known to remove ambiguities due to illumination or surface pose.
        Parameters:
        red - Red coefficient.
        green - Green coefficient.
        blue - Blue coefficient.
        Returns:
        Normalized RGChromaticity. Range[0..1].
        See Also:
        Information Processing - Chi Sing Leung. p. 668

      • RGBtoHSV

        public static float[] RGBtoHSV(int red,
               int green,
               int blue)
        RGB -> HSV. Adds (hue + 360) % 360 for represent hue in the range [0..359].
        Parameters:
        red - Red coefficient. Values in the range [0..255].
        green - Green coefficient. Values in the range [0..255].
        blue - Blue coefficient. Values in the range [0..255].
        Returns:
        HSV color space.

      • HSVtoRGB

        public static int[] HSVtoRGB(float hue,
             float saturation,
             float value)
        HSV -> RGB.
        Parameters:
        hue - Hue.
        saturation - Saturation. In the range[0..1].
        value - Value. In the range[0..1].
        Returns:
        RGB color space. In the range[0..255].
